data.title: Fun and lot's of yummy food!
data.text: Stopped in after eating lunch at Primetime, which is across the street, to get a few dessert items to take back to our hotel. Interior is huge, and has a European style deli atmosphere. They also have outdoor tables and chairs. There are rows of wine, and refrigerated deli display cases with meats, cheeses, salads, prepared foods,a bakery, and desserts. It was bustling with lively conversation and happy customers. We got one flan and one chocolate cake to go, which we ate when returning to our hotel after attending a Stevie Nicks concert. Both were yummy!

data.title: Consistently Good
data.text: My husband and I are always pleased with the food, whether it's breakfast lunch or dinner. It's a nice walk from our home and on balmy evenings delightful to sit outside and watch the goings on in the town center. Empanadas are awesome. Salads delish, steak and lasagna yummy.  Argentine done well.  They also have a meat market and bakery.

data.title: Lovely people and great food
data.text: We were treated very kindly when asking about vegetarian options and had some delicious empanadas and desserts.  it is very clean with a pleasant atmosphere.

data.title: Terrific
data.text: Meal was like being back in Buenos Aires!  Delicious steak and empanadas.  Comfortable and easy and warm, just loved every minute of it, plus a delicious Malbec for only $23.  Really a deal and great food.  Loved their Chaja cake dessert, filled with dulce de leche.  We will come back here for sure.

data.title: Very crowded, staff rude.
data.text: The place was packed.  The staff will push past you physically bumping into you without saying anything while waiting in line.  Very rude and obnoxious.  The servers putting our order together did not pay attention and switched boxes of empanadas we were purchacing.   This place needs to be better organized to flow better.  If going there for your first time, be prepared to be confused and get some bruises.

data.title: YOU'LL FALL IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE!
data.text: On our recent trip in September 2016 we had the opportunity to dine at Graziano's with my son, his lady and her entire family. They chose the restaurant and I was skeptical at first. We didn't know what the food would be like or the place. Ok, rest assured if you haven't tried Argentinian food - give it a try.  The restaurant/very refined gourmet food and bakery establishment - very New York cosmopolitan eatery - nice people, beautiful products, baked goods were something to see and eat.  We tried the beef empanadas, spinach torta, salad and dessert - all well prepared and high quality products - so delicious! My son has orders to being empanadas back to Ohio for Christmas - yes, that good.  If you are a foodie - this is the real deal. Run!!!

data.title: Good food
data.text: Grazianos is a restaurant, butcher shop, and specialty grocery store rolled into 1.  The restaurant food is good and reasonably priced (although empanadas are overpriced and overrated). Butcher shop/deli has some great cuts of meat including Bresaola, which we had trouble finding. Julio at the butcher counter was a delight, and made our visit! Will be back again to visit Julio and buy some steaks.

data.title: Great meat
data.text: Great food, the meat is outstanding. Ine of the biggest issue is there is not enough space to sit, victim of their success

data.title: Good
data.text:
Ordered a ham empanada as well as a cheese empanada.  Tasty.  House sangria was fruity and not too tart with fresh fruit . 
House panini had prosciutto with mozzarella and tomato.  It was bland and needed some type of condiment.  
Took a tiramisu and choc fondant slice to go. The desserts did not live up to the meal.
50 bucks total for two and that was splitting and sharing the panini. 
I posted pics.
If you find this review helpful please acknowledge.

data.title: First time in this place
data.text:
I went with my family for first time and enjoyed it very much. I liked the idea and the food was also very good 
Maybe a little noise but it's the concept so I would say that everything was very good

data.title: Very Overpriced, but yummy.
data.text: They have very yummy empandas, but extremely overpriced. I have had bigger and better empanadas in Miami and it cost less.  We enjoy this place, we would come more often if it was better priced.

data.title: Nice environment! Great service
data.text: Nice place to enjoy lunch or dinner with friends or family, the menu is diverse.  Great service, food quality is really good. The picanha is a must! You can also taste a good wine. This Argentinian restaurant came to Weston to cover a real need in having a good restaurant in the city.  Really love this place. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great Family food and atmosphere.
data.text: The empanadas are fabulous.  My son has me purchase several every time we go, he loves them.  I really like the meat market inside.  The butcher is always so friendly and knowledgeable of meats.  This is the only place I purchase any type of steaks.  I think their price is wonderful also. It is worth the trip if you do not live near by.

data.title: Good to have something different. Menu is varied.
data.text:
Atmosphere is a happy one.Mainly young people but also some elderly ones.
You can also buy food and other stuff home.

data.title: Excellent quality food, very affordable, service could improve
data.text: The quality of the meat cuts is very good.  Empanadas are to die for.  Wine selection is very varied and at excellent prices.  My only problem is basically the "lack" of service since basically there are no servers, just runners bringing out your food.  No one follows up your table.  You stand up to the register, order, pay and someone runs your food.  if you are looking for service to your table, this is not your place.  If you can live with that, I invite you to give them a try.

data.title: Always Enjoyable!
data.text: We came back to this Weston restaurant after being here in 2014. It was as delicious as we remembered it being. The food prices are reasonable. The empanadas were really tasty and there is a good variety of choices. Even though the place was crowded at 1:30, our food came quickly and was cooked perfectly. We will go back the next time we are in Weston.

data.title: Very good choise
data.text: Nice Restaurant, reasonable prices, good food alternatives, fast service.. Plenty of parking... We really enyoyed the place. Good Wine selection. You pick up the wine you want  ($9.00 average) and pay just ($10.00) corkage. I recommend it!!

data.title: Best Cappuccino!
data.text:
The best cappuccino, I love this place the prices are suitable for family out and business meeting.
You can chose to sit outside or inside depending on weather. I love the European stily.

data.title: Awful
data.text:
We had eaten at Graziano's this same week on vacation a year ago 2015, loved the Malbec wine served at the bar. The bartender advised us to buy the bottle which she opened as it was cheaper than her serving a glass at a time. There was no corkage fee. We ordered fish and understood it was swordfish. It was not it was a fish comparable to tilapia.  

So now we go this year and want an Argentine beef steak which we ordered medium rare. We bought a bottle of Malbec to have at the restaurant with our meal. This was done at the cash register. We were charged a $10 corkage fee on a bottle of $19 wine. We were quite shocked but sucked it up to "never again"! Then we got our food, steaks ordered med. rare which were served medium well! We went back to the counter regarding the problem. The steaks were replaced with steaks that were rare to the point of being cold & literally raw. We asked for a to go box and took them back to our time share and cooked them to medium rare. We will never go back! We were just in Argentina and had wonderful food everywhere we ate although only 2% of all people in South America speak English. Apparently only 1 person at Graziano's speaks English so maybe our problem was partially language. If you do not speak fluent Spanish or like your steak well done or raw don't bother eating here! I guess I'm also ticked that I gave a $15 tip at the cash register. What was I thinking?

data.title: Grazianos restaurant
data.text: Visiting friends in Fort Lauderdale and decided to go to Sawgrass Mills Mall. First a stop in Weston to have lunch at Grazianos. Had a delicious chicken in pastry appetizer followed by a great tasting salad. The restaurant was busy the whole time I was there. Staff were efficient and friendly. Great way to spend lunch before SHOPPING !!!
